entry.title: Volunteers Needed
entry.content:
The Brassfield PTA needs parent volunteers to assist with maintaining the media center’s math and science kits. Each kit engages children in a different math or science topic through at-home experiments, activities, books, and/or games. Students may check the kits out weekly during their media center time. The PTA funds all of the kits’ supplies, which are located in the PTA room.

Any amount of volunteer help is appreciated, and can be done at any time during school hours. Most kits take just a few minutes each to clean and restock. If you’d like to help out please contact Julie at julschiavone@gmail.com or Tara at tarawilk@live.com.

To learn about other opportunities to help at Brassfield for registered volunteers, please visit the following links:

  • Assist at a school-wide functions (entire school year dates located here)
  • Assist or serve on a PTA committee

entry.title: Cookie Boxes for Teachers and Staff

link.title: Cookie Boxes for Teachers and Staff

entry.content:
It's hard to believe the holidays are upon us. That means it's almost time to get out the flour and sugar and send some good cheer to all of the teachers and staff at Brassfield who do so much for our children every day. Each year, the PTA Staff Appreciation & Hospitality Committee, together with the support of our wonderful parent volunteers, assembles a box of homemade cookies for each teacher and staff member at the school. We hear countless compliments and words of thanks for doing this and have been told repeatedly it's one of the favorite days of the school year.

To sign up please go to Holiday Cookie Boxes.

entry.title: FUNDRAISER for BOOKS! – Who will win??!

link.title: FUNDRAISER for BOOKS! -- Who will win??!

entry.content:
Next week, 11/13-11/17, we will be doing a change drive to help raise money for kids in local communities who need books! Any additional money raised may be used to buy books for our school library or help teachers refresh their classroom libraries.

Bring in those pennies, nickels, dimes and quarters to fill the jug in the lobby. Who will be able to fill the jug faster, boys or girls? As an added bonus, Scholastic will purchase a book for each $1 raised and provide up to 1 million books to charities such as the Kids In Need Foundation, Reader to Reader, Inc., and the National Center for Families Learning.

entry.title: Character Parade - Tuesday, 10/31
entry.content:
Calling all characters! Book characters, that is! In a celebration of reading, Brassfield students will parade the school on October 31st carrying their favorite book, dressed as their favorite character. Classrooms across the school will tie the experience to grade level curriculum. From Winnie the Pooh to Harry Potter we can't wait to bring books to life! Be on the lookout for specific information on how to participate from your teacher. Track 3 families are encouraged to come back to school and participate, but be sure to check into the front office with Kimberly when you arrive.

Registered Volunteers - Sign up to assist

entry.title: K-3 Mandate Presentation and Discussion - PLEASE REGISTER

link.title: K-3 Mandate Presentation and Discussion - PLEASE REGISTER

entry.content:
What: Advocacy Presentation and Discussion
Who will be presenting: Wake County PTA Council and Public Schools First NC
When:Monday, 10/16, from 7-8pm
Where: Brassfield Road Elementary School Media Center
For: Brassfield, Baileywick, and Wakefield ES parents and area PTA Boards.

Please RSVP to attend here.

The North Carolina Legislature passed an unfunded K-3 class size mandate last spring which will take full effect in 2018-2019. Join us on October 16 to hear about the mandate, how it will affect Wake County Public Schools, and the possible solutions offered by the school district to deal with the new requirements. We will also discuss what PTA units, leaders, members and parents can do to advocate for our students and teachers.

Come join us to be part of an open discussion of strategy ideas to affect change! Questions? Tania

entry.title: Book Fair Volunteer Information Session - Monday, 10/16

link.title: Book Fair Volunteer Information Session - Monday, 10/16

entry.content:
The book fair committee is looking for volunteers to help with our Winter Book Fair! We will have an informational meeting at 2:00pm on Monday, October 16th in the Learning Commons to go over areas where help is needed and the estimated time commitment for each job. Some items can even be done from home, and no amount of help is too small! This year, all proceeds from the fair will go towards improving our library collection, so please stop in and see how you can help make this fundraiser a success! Questions? Email Erica Tadd

-Thanks,The Book Fair Committee
